# Writing Checklist

Quality validation rules for every generated post.
Based on top creator research and proven viral structures.

## Pre-Publish Checklist

Every post MUST pass all checks before being returned.

---

## 1. Hook Validation (Critical)

### One-Liner Hook Check
- [ ] First line is a strong hook (grabs attention immediately)
- [ ] Hook is under 12 words
- [ ] Hook creates curiosity or states value
- [ ] No backstory in hook (get to the point)

### Good Hook Examples:
- "I just shipped my first CLI app."
- "Stop wasting time on free API keys."
- "Spent 4 hours debugging a race condition."
- "Big moment for me."

### Bad Hooks (Auto-Reject):
- "So today I wanted to share something..." (too slow)
- "I've been working on this for a while..." (backstory first)
- "Hey everyone, hope you're doing well..." (filler)

---

## 2. Content Validation

### Banned Words Check
- [ ] No marketing hype phrases (game-changing, revolutionary, groundbreaking)
- [ ] No engagement bait (you won't believe, stop scrolling)
- [ ] No tech bro clich√©s (crushing it, thought leader, ninja)
- [ ] No performative humility (humbled to announce, I don't mean to brag)
- [ ] No empty filler phrases (at the end of the day, needless to say)

### Auto-Reject If Any Of:
- "game-changing" OR "revolutionary" OR "groundbreaking"
- "paradigm shift" OR "quantum leap"
- "crushing it" OR "killing it" OR "smashed it"
- "thought leader" OR "visionary" OR "ninja"
- "humbled to announce" OR "I don't mean to brag"
- "you won't believe" OR "stop scrolling"
- "at the end of the day" OR "needless to say"

---

## 3. Sentence Structure (Updated for Performance)

### Length Check (Research-Based)
- [ ] Most sentences under 10 words (70%+)
- [ ] All sentences under 12 words (strict: <12 words performs 20% better)
- [ ] No sentence over 15 words (auto-reject if found)
- [ ] One idea per sentence (no compound sentences with 3+ clauses)

### Simple English Check
- [ ] Words are simple (non-native friendly)
- [ ] No complex vocabulary
- [ ] Active voice, not passive
- [ ] Specific over vague (numbers, names, details)

### Auto-Reject Patterns:
- Sentences over 15 words (strict: over-performing posts use <12)
- More than 2 clauses per sentence
- Passive voice in >30% of sentences
- Complex vocabulary (e.g., "utilize" instead of "use")

---

## 4. Scannability Rules (Critical for Mobile)

### Formatting Requirements
- [ ] **Break most lines to new lines** (makes it scannable)
- [ ] **Some lines combined for flow** (when breaking feels forced)
- [ ] **Max 3-4 lines per paragraph** (no walls of text)
- [ ] **No walls of text** (auto-reject if 5+ lines without break)
- [ ] Simple words throughout
- [ ] Use bullets for lists (üëâ, ‚Üí, 1., 2., 3.)

### Line Breaking Strategy

**Default:** Break thoughts to new lines
**Sometimes:** Combine related ideas for natural flow

**Good Balance (Most broken, some combined):**
```
I built a team task CLI. Not a simple todo app, but a task assignment system for agencies.

The requirement was to build a todo CLI.
Most people would add tasks, mark them done, delete them.

But I thought: what if agencies need to assign work to teams?

So I built:
 ‚Ä¢ Create and assign tasks
 ‚Ä¢ Filter by status or assignee
```

**Too Broken (Artificial):**
```
I built a team task CLI.
Not a simple todo app.
But for agencies.

The requirement was:
Build a todo CLI.
```

**Too Combined (Wall of text):**
```
I built a team task CLI called TaskFlow which is a task assignment system for agencies because the requirement was to build a todo CLI but most people would add tasks and mark them done.
```

### Auto-Reject If:
- Any paragraph has 4+ lines without break
- Lines exceed 80 characters consistently
- No white space between thoughts

---

## 5. Platform Length Validation (Updated)

### LinkedIn (700-1000 chars optimal)
- [ ] Between 700-1000 characters (sweet spot)
- [ ] Under 1300 characters (hard limit)
- [ ] First 1-3 lines hook reader (before "See More")
- [ ] Ends with 3-5 hashtags
- [ ] Ends with CTA (question or prompt)

### Length Ranges by Goal:
| Goal | Character Range |
|------|-----------------|
| Optimal engagement | 700-1000 |
| Maximum reach | 900-1200 |
| Hard limit | 3000 |
| "See More" cutoff | ~140 |

### Twitter/X (200-270 chars optimal)
- [ ] Between 200-270 characters
- [ ] Under 280 characters (hard limit)
- [ ] 2-3 hashtags
- [ ] One clear insight per tweet

### WhatsApp Status (50-150 chars)
- [ ] Between 50-150 characters
- [ ] 1-2 sentences
- [ ] No hashtags
- [ ] Personal, casual

---

## 6. Emoji and Punctuation

### Emojis (Use Sparingly)
- [ ] Max 1-2 emojis total (LinkedIn)
- [ ] Max 1 emoji (Twitter)
- [ ] Use intentionally for impact
- [ ] No random emojis

### Punctuation
- [ ] Max 1-2 exclamation points total
- [ ] Periods preferred over excitement
- [ ] No ALL CAPS words (except acronyms like AI, API)

### Auto-Reject If:
- More than 2 emojis (LinkedIn) or 1 (Twitter)
- More than 2 exclamation points
- ALL CAPS words (except acronyms)

---

## 7. CTA Validation (Required)

### Call-to-Action Check
- [ ] **Ends with CTA** (question or prompt)
- [ ] CTA encourages engagement (comments, shares)
- [ ] CTA is relevant to content

### Good CTAs:
- "What's your first project? üëá"
- "Ever hit a race condition? What happened? üëá"
- "What's your setup? üëá"
- "Would love your thoughts."

### Bad CTAs (Avoid):
- "Like and share!" (engagement bait)
- "Follow for more!" (too generic)
- No CTA at all (missed engagement)

---

## 8. Tone Validation

### Voice Check
- [ ] Sounds like a real human (not marketing bot)
- [ ] Casual but professional
- [ ] Honest about struggles, not just wins
- [ ] Direct, not dramatic
- [ ] Simple English (non-native friendly)

### Markers Of Inauthentic Tone (Auto-Reject):
- Excessive exclamation points (more than 2)
- All caps words (except acronyms)
- Over-promising ("will change your life")
- Vague superlatives ("amazing", "incredible") without specifics

### Authentic Tone Markers (Good):
- Specific numbers ("3 weeks", "50K impressions")
- Real names ("Muhammad Soban", not "a creator")
- Admissions of doubt ("I wasn't sure", "I struggled")
- Concrete details ("FastAPI + React", not "cutting-edge tech")
- Simple words ("use" not "utilize", "help" not "facilitate")

---

## 9. Platform-Specific Checks

### LinkedIn (700-1000 chars)
- [ ] One-liner hook first
- [ ] Max 3 lines per paragraph
- [ ] Space between every line
- [ ] Ends with 3-5 hashtags
- [ ] Ends with question or prompt
- [ ] Includes specific details or numbers
- [ ] Between 700-1000 characters (optimal)

### Twitter/X (200-270 chars)
- [ ] One clear insight per tweet
- [ ] Thread numbered (1/, 2/, 3/) if multi-tweet
- [ ] 2-3 hashtags per tweet
- [ ] Each tweet under 280 chars
- [ ] Between 200-270 chars (optimal)

### WhatsApp Status (50-150 chars)
- [ ] Brief (1-2 sentences)
- [ ] Personal, casual
- [ ] No hashtags
- [ ] Between 50-150 chars

---

## 10. Viral Structure Validation

### Must Use One Of These Structures:

#### Structure 1: Justin Welsh 5-Step
- [ ] Hook (lines 1-2): Bold statement or truth
- [ ] Setup (lines 3-5): Brief context
- [ ] Value Bomb: The meat of content
- [ ] Takeaway: Key lesson
- [ ] CTA: Question or prompt

#### Structure 2: Aisha Riaz Problem-Solve
- [ ] Problem: What you were solving
- [ ] Process: What you did
- [ ] Outcome: What happened (with numbers)
- [ ] Lesson: What you learned
- [ ] CTA: Question or prompt

#### Structure 3: S.T.A.R. Framework
- [ ] Situation: What you were working on
- [ ] Task: What you needed to solve
- [ ] Action: What you actually did
- [ ] Result: What happened (with metrics)
- [ ] CTA: Question or prompt

#### Structure 4: Authentic Voice
- [ ] Hook: Vulnerable admission
- [ ] Backstory: "I held back..."
- [ ] Turning Point: "But then..."
- [ ] Action: What you did
- [ ] Result: What happened
- [ ] Reflection: What you'd tell others
- [ ] CTA: Question or prompt

---

## 11. Content Type Validation

### Achievement Post
- [ ] Clear outcome in hook (first line)
- [ ] What you did (tech stack, timeline)
- [ ] Numbers or metrics
- [ ] Key lesson learned
- [ ] CTA at end

### Technical Post
- [ ] Problem statement in hook
- [ ] Your approach/solution
- [ ] Code snippet or technical detail
- [ ] Result/lesson
- [ ] CTA at end

### Hackathon Post
- [ ] What you built (hook)
- [ ] Challenge faced
- [ ] How you solved it
- [ ] What you'd do differently
- [ ] CTA at end

### Advice Post
- [ ] Observation or tip in hook
- [ ] Common mistake you see
- [ ] What actually works
- [ ] Specific example or steps
- [ ] Why this is better
- [ ] CTA at end

### Announcement Post
- [ ] Big moment in hook
- [ ] What you're launching
- [ ] Why it matters
- [ ] Who it's for
- [ ] CTA with link

---

## 12. Final Quality Checks

### Minimum Viable Post
- [ ] Has a clear point or insight
- [ ] Provides value to reader
- [ ] Sounds human (not bot)
- [ ] Platform-appropriate length
- [ ] No banned phrases
- [ ] Ends with CTA
- [ ] Uses simple English

### Optional But Recommended:
- [ ] Vulnerability (admits struggle or doubt)
- [ ] Specifics (names, numbers, details)
- [ ] Relevant hashtags (3-5)
- [ ] Scannable formatting

---

## Quick Reference Card

### Auto-Reject (Don't Return Post If Any Of These)

| Check | Threshold | Action |
|-------|-----------|--------|
| No hook in first line | Missing hook | REJECT |
| Banned words | Any found | REJECT |
| Sentence length | >15 words | REJECT |
| Wall of text | 4+ lines without break | REJECT |
| Exclamation points | >2 | REJECT |
| Emojis (LI) | >2 | REJECT |
| Hashtags (LI) | >5 | REJECT |
| Length (LI) | >1300 chars | REJECT |
| Length (LI optimal) | <700 or >1000 | WARN |
| No CTA | Missing | REJECT |
| Complex words | Non-simple | WARN |

### Optimal Ranges (Aim For These)

| Metric | LinkedIn | Twitter | WhatsApp |
|--------|----------|---------|----------|
| Characters | 700-1000 | 200-270 | 50-150 |
| Sentence length | <10 words | <10 words | <12 words |
| Lines per paragraph | Max 3 | Max 2 | Max 2 |
| Emojis | 1-2 | 0-1 | 0-1 |
| Hashtags | 3-5 | 2-3 | 0 |

---

## Research Sources

These rules are based on analysis of:
- **Justin Welsh**: 5-step formula, 162M+ impressions
- **Aisha Riaz**: Problem ‚Üí Process ‚Üí Outcome ‚Üí Lesson structure
- **LinkedIn Marketing**: 900-1200 chars optimal reach
- **AuthoredUp Stats**: Sentences <12 words perform 20% better
- **Top Creator Analysis**: Hook-first, scannable format wins
